They do not hear of the perfection of giving, do not cultivate the perfection of giving, do not hear of the perfection of morality, do not cultivate the perfection of morality, do not hear of the perfection of patience, do not cultivate the perfection of patience, do not hear of the perfection of vigor, do not cultivate the perfection of vigor, do not hear of the perfection of meditation, do not cultivate the perfection of meditation, do not hear of the perfection of wisdom, do not cultivate the perfection of wisdom;

They do not hear of internal emptiness, do not cultivate internal emptiness, and do not hear of external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, empty emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, conditioned emptiness, unconditioned emptiness, absolute emptiness, endless emptiness, dispersed emptiness, unchanging emptiness, inherent emptiness, specific emptiness, common emptiness, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-attainment, emptiness of nature, emptiness of self-nature, or emptiness of the nature of non-existence, and do not cultivate external emptiness up to the emptiness of the nature of non-existence;

They do not hear of suchness, do not cultivate suchness, and do not hear of the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, nature of detachment from birth, dharma determination, dharma abiding, reality limit, space realm, or inconceivable realm, and do not cultivate the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm;

They do not hear the noble truth of suffering, do not cultivate the noble truth of suffering, do not hear the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering, do not cultivate the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering;

They do not hear the four concentrations, do not cultivate the four concentrations, do not hear the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations, do not cultivate the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations;

They do not hear the eight liberations, do not cultivate the eight liberations, do not hear the eight superior realms, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases, do not cultivate the eight superior realms, nine successive concentrations, and ten universal bases;

They do not hear the four establishments of mindfulness, do not cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness, do not hear the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path, do not cultivate the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path;

They do not hear the emptiness liberation gate, do not cultivate the emptiness liberation gate, do not hear the signless and wishless liberation gates, do not cultivate the signless and wishless liberation gates;
They do not hear of the five eyes and do not cultivate the five eyes, they do not hear of the six spiritual powers and do not cultivate the six spiritual powers;

They do not hear of the ten powers of the Buddha and do not cultivate the ten powers of the Buddha, they do not hear of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, and do not cultivate the four fearlessnesses up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha;
They do not hear of the unhindered mind and do not cultivate the unhindered mind, they do not hear of the nature of abiding in abandonment and do not cultivate the nature of abiding in abandonment;
They do not hear of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways and do not cultivate all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, they do do not hear of all samÄdhi gateways and do not cultivate all samÄdhi gateways;

They do not hear of omniscience and do not cultivate omniscience, they do not hear of the cognition of the path and cognition of all aspects and do not cultivate the cognition of the path and cognition of all aspects.

I observe with my pure and unobstructed Buddha eye the worlds in the ten directions, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River. Although there are innumerable, countless, and boundless beings who set their minds on supreme perfect enlightenment and diligently cultivate the practices leading to enlightenment, due to being far removed from the profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and skillful means, only one, two, or three beings may attain the stage of nonretrogression among the bodhisattvas, while the majority fall back into the inferior stages of the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.
Why is this?
KauÅ›ika!
Supreme perfect enlightenment is extremely difficult to attain, because beings of inferior wisdom, laziness, inferior diligence, inferior resolve, and inferior capacity are unable to realize it.
KauÅ›ika!

For this reason, if good men and good women give rise to the mind set on supreme perfect enlightenment, diligently cultivate the practices leading to enlightenment, wish to abide on the irreversible stage of the bodhisattvas, and quickly realize supreme perfect enlightenment without obstruction, they should repeatedly listen to, uphold, recite, diligently cultivate, contemplate according to the principles, enjoy asking the teacher for clarification, and delight in explaining it to others.

Having done these things, they should also write it out, adorn it with various precious substances, make offerings, pay homage, respect and praise it, and further make offerings with various excellent flower garlands, ointments, incense, scattered [incense], clothing, necklaces, jeweled banners, pennants, canopies, various wonderful treasures, music, and lamps.
KauÅ›ika!
